intro: Macroclinidium hybridum, commonly known as the hybrid grassvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
